fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article referred to “Britain’s trains” in relation to the government’s suspension of rail franchises when the Department for Transport’s announcement related to England only (Trains nationalised for at least six months to avoid franchise failures, 24 March, page 14). • An article (UK travellers: Get home right now, warns Raab, 24 March, page 2) incorrectly placed Wellington in New Zealand’s South Island; the country’s capital is at the southern tip of the North Island. • Other recently amended articles include: Former London bankers convicted after Germany’s ‘greatest tax robbery’ Zagreb hit by earthquake while in coronovirus lockdown Police vow to enforce virus pub ban as some in UK continue to gather US states improvise rules to combat coronavirus in absence of federal leadership Genesis P-Orridge: troubling catalyst who loathed rock yet changed it forever Revealed: rightwing push to suppress criticism of Israel on US campuses New York: college volleyball players kneel during Israeli national anthem
